availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Franklin Bryan Chinn (Franklin County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Franklin County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of William Chinn and Sarah Bryan Chinn. Married to Mary Scott Chinn in 1827. Father of William L. Chinn, Amanda Chinn French, and Mary Chinn. Married Anne Bell Wells Chinn in 1835. Father of Sarah J. Chinn, Anna E. Chinn, Clement Bell Chinn, and Franklin Chinn. Resident in Henry County, Kentucky, in 1830. Owned three enslaved persons in Henry County in 1830. Resident in Franklin County in 1840. Owned five enslaved persons in Franklin County in 1840. Farmer in Franklin County in 1850. Owned eight enslaved persons in Franklin County in 1850. Farmer in Franklin County in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in Franklin County in 1860.
